birth_place.zh-cn: 大清福建省福州府闽县

death_place.zh-cn: 台湾省台北市古亭区马场町刑场

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，同时也是中共地下党成员和台湾白色恐怖受难者。因向中国共产党泄露大量情报，于1950年在台湾被处决，后被中华人民共和国追认为革命烈士。
description.en: A lieutenant general in the Republic of China Army, who was also an underground member of the Chinese Communist Party and a victim of the White Terror in Taiwan. He was executed in Taiwan in 1950 for leaking extensive intelligence to the CCP and was posthumously recognized as a revolutionary martyr by the People's Republic of China.

en: Ministry of National Defense (Republic of China)

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的国防事务主管机关。
description.en: The cabinet-level agency responsible for the defense affairs of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 国防部政务办公室史政编译处

zh-cn: 国防部政务办公室史政编译处

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国防部下属机构，负责史料的整理与编译工作。
description.en: A subordinate body of the Ministry of National Defense of the Republic of China, responsible for the compilation and translation of historical materials.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民革命军的集团军之一。
description.en: An army group of the National Revolutionary Army of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国福建省福州府下辖的一个县，为吴石的出生地。
description.en: A county under Fuzhou Prefecture, Fujian Province, China, and the birthplace of Wu Shi.

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾台北市的刑场，在台湾白色恐怖时期为主要的政治犯处决地之一，吴石于此地被处决。
description.en: An execution ground in Taipei, Taiwan, which was one of the main sites for executing political prisoners during the White Terror period. Wu Shi was executed here.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党民主派人士创建的政治组织，为中国国民党革命委员会的前身之一。
description.en: A political organization founded by democratic members of the Kuomintang, one of the predecessors of the Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang.

nodes.id: 中国国民党革命委员会

zh-cn: 中国国民党革命委员会
en: Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国现有的民主党派之一，由中国国民党民主派及其他爱国民主人士创建。
description.en: One of the existing democratic parties in the People's Republic of China, founded by democratic members of the Kuomintang and other patriotic democrats.

description.zh-cn: 吴石的妻子，曾因吴石案牵连入狱。
description.en: Wife of Wu Shi, who was implicated and imprisoned due to Wu Shi's case.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的陆上武装部队。
description.en: The ground branch of the Republic of China Armed Forces.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指中国国民党主政的中华民国政府在台湾进行的镇压异议人士的时期。
description.en: Refers to the period of suppression of dissidents in Taiwan by the Republic of China government under the rule of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代史上第一所正规陆军军校。
description.en: The first regular army military academy in modern Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家，由中国共产党领导。
description.en: A country in East Asia led by the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府授予为国家和人民利益牺牲的公民的荣誉称号。
description.en: An honorary title awarded by the government of the People's Republic of China to citizens who sacrificed their lives for the interests of the nation and the people.

description.zh-cn: 1911年在中国武昌发生的一场旨在推翻清朝统治的兵变，是辛亥革命的开端。
description.en: A military mutiny against the ruling Qing dynasty that took place in Wuchang, China in 1911, marking the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初在中国武昌设立的军事预备学校。
description.en: A military preparatory school established in Wuchang, China, during the late Qing dynasty and early Republican era.

en: Japanese Army Artillery and Engineering School

description.zh-cn: 旧日本陆军的军事学校，吴石曾在此就读。
description.en: A military school of the former Imperial Japanese Army, where Wu Shi once studied.

description.zh-cn: 旧日本陆军培养高级指挥官和参谋的最高军事学府。
description.en: The highest military institution of the former Imperial Japanese Army for training senior commanders and staff officers.

en: General Staff Headquarters of the Nationalist Government

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府时期的最高军事幕僚机构。
description.en: The highest military staff organization during the period of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府时期中国的最高军事指挥机构。
description.en: The supreme military command body of China during the Nationalist Government era.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期国民政府在桂林设立的军事指挥机构。
description.en: A military command established in Guilin by the Nationalist Government during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争时期，中华民国国民政府划分的战区之一。
description.en: One of the war zones designated by the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争时期中华民国的战时首都及中央政府所在地。
description.en: The wartime capital and seat of the central government of the Republic of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国军事及政治人物，对吴石为共产党工作有重要影响。
description.en: A Chinese military and political figure who had a significant influence on Wu Shi's work for the Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 何遂之子，曾参与吴石与中共的联络工作，并主持了吴石的骨灰安葬仪式。
description.en: Son of He Sui, who participated in the liaison work between Wu Shi and the CCP, and presided over the burial ceremony for Wu Shi's ashes.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党官员、外交官，曾任中共中央上海局书记，与吴石会面。
description.en: A CCP official and diplomat, who served as Secretary of the CCP Shanghai Bureau and met with Wu Shi.

en: Shanghai Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会在上海设立的派出机构。
description.en: A dispatched agency established in Shanghai by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战中的“三大战役”之一。
description.en: One of the three major campaigns during the second phase of the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党地下党员，在吴石的帮助下获得重要军事情报。
description.en: An underground member of the Chinese Communist Party who obtained crucial military intelligence with the help of Wu Shi.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党情报及文化战线的高级领导人，接收了由吴石提供、吴仲禧转交的情报。
description.en: A senior leader in the intelligence and cultural fronts of the Chinese Communist Party, who received intelligence provided by Wu Shi and transferred by Wu Zhongxi.

description.zh-cn: 时任华中剿匪指挥部情报科科长，在吴石指示下向吴仲禧提供情报。
description.en: Then head of the intelligence section of the Central China Bandit Suppression Command, who provided intelligence to Wu Zhongxi under Wu Shi's instruction.

description.zh-cn: 东亚的岛屿，吴石在此地从事地下工作并最终被处决。
description.en: An island in East Asia where Wu Shi conducted underground activities and was eventually executed.

en: East China Bureau of the CCP

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在华东地区的领导机构。
description.en: The leading body of the Chinese Communist Party in the East China region.

description.zh-cn: 何遂之女，曾赴台与吴石建立联系。
description.en: Daughter of He Sui, who traveled to Taiwan to establish contact with Wu Shi.

description.zh-cn: 台湾的城市，吴石在此地进行情报工作并被捕。
description.en: A city in Taiwan where Wu Shi conducted intelligence work and was arrested.

description.zh-cn: 中共地下党员，与吴石秘密会面传递情报，在吴石案中被判处死刑。
description.en: An underground member of the CCP who met secretly with Wu Shi to transfer intelligence and was sentenced to death in the Wu Shi case.

description.zh-cn: 1950年发生在台湾的重大中共间谍案件，导致吴石、朱谌之（朱枫）等多名中共情报人员被捕并被处决。
description.en: A major CCP espionage case that occurred in Taiwan in 1950, leading to the arrest and execution of several CCP intelligence agents, including Wu Shi and Zhu Chenzhi (Zhu Feng).

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统。他指派了吴石案的审判官，并因审判官为吴石等人陈情而震怒。
description.en: A Chinese political and military leader who served as the President of the Republic of China. He appointed the judges for Wu Shi's case and was enraged when they pleaded for clemency for Wu Shi and others.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军上将，被蒋中正指派负责审判吴石案，后因替吴石等人陈情而受处分。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army, appointed by Chiang Kai-shek to preside over the trial of the Wu Shi case. He was later disciplined for pleading for clemency for Wu Shi and others.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军上将，参与审判吴石案，后因替吴石等人陈情而受处分。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army who participated in the trial of the Wu Shi case and was later disciplined for pleading for clemency.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军上将，参与审判吴石案，后因替吴石等人陈情而受处分。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army who participated in the trial of the Wu Shi case and was later disciplined for pleading for clemency.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，因吴石案被判处死刑。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army who was sentenced to death in the Wu Shi case.

description.zh-cn: 因吴石案被判处死刑的中共情报人员。
description.en: A CCP intelligence agent who was sentenced to death in the Wu Shi case.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首任国务院总理，在他的干预下，吴石被追认为革命烈士。
description.en: The first Premier of the People's Republic of China, under whose intervention Wu Shi was posthumously recognized as a revolutionary martyr.

description.zh-cn: 吴石的次女，1991年将其父骨灰从台湾带回大陆。
description.en: Wu Shi's second daughter, who brought her father's ashes back to mainland China from Taiwan in 1991.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京市的公墓，吴石的骨灰安葬于此。
description.en: A cemetery in Beijing where Wu Shi's ashes are buried.

location.zh-cn: 北京西山国家森林公园

description.zh-cn: 位于北京西山国家森林公园，为纪念在台湾牺牲的中共情报人员而建，广场上竖有吴石等人的雕像。
description.en: Located in Beijing Xishan National Forest Park, built to commemorate CCP intelligence agents who died in Taiwan. The square features statues of Wu Shi and others.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高监察机关。
description.en: The highest supervisory body of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 吴石的长子。
description.en: Wu Shi's eldest son.

description.zh-cn: 吴石的长女，在文化大革命期间受到迫害。
description.en: Wu Shi's eldest daughter, who was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的在中国发生的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement in China launched and led by Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 吴石的幼子。
description.en: Wu Shi's youngest son.

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾台北市的综合性研究型公立大学。
description.en: A comprehensive public research university located in Taipei, Taiwan.

position.en: Deputy Chief of the General Staff

relationships.target: 国防部政务办公室史政编译处
中国国民党革命委员会

description.zh-cn: 吴石作为中共地下党员，向中国共产党泄漏了大量军事情报。
description.en: As an underground member of the CCP, Wu Shi leaked a large amount of military intelligence to the Chinese Communist Party.

position.en: Chief of the First Section, Second Department
Chief of Staff of the Headquarters

description.zh-cn: 吴石在台湾白色恐怖时期被视为“匪谍”而遭逮捕并被处决，是该时期的著名受难者之一。
description.en: Wu Shi was arrested and executed as a 'communist spy' during the White Terror period in Taiwan, becoming one of the prominent victims of that era.

description.zh-cn: 在周恩来的干预下，中华人民共和国追认吴石为革命烈士。
description.en: Under the intervention of Zhou Enlai, the People's Republic of China posthumously recognized Wu Shi as a revolutionary martyr.

description.zh-cn: 干预并推动了中华人民共和国追认吴石为革命烈士一事。
description.en: Intervened and promoted the posthumous recognition of Wu Shi as a revolutionary martyr by the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 吴石响应武昌起义，报名参加了福州北伐学生军。
description.en: In response to the Wuchang Uprising, Wu Shi signed up for the Fuzhou Northern Expedition Student Army.

description.zh-cn: 1947年在上海首次会面商谈，1949年8月在台北再次联系，何遂说服吴石继续为中共工作。
description.en: First met in Shanghai in 1947 for discussions, and reconnected in Taipei in August 1949, where He Sui persuaded Wu Shi to continue working for the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 在台北与吴石会面，影响并说服他继续为中国共产党工作。
description.en: Met with Wu Shi in Taipei, influencing and persuading him to continue working for the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 帮助吴仲禧取得《淮海战场形势图》等重要情报。
description.en: Helped Wu Zhongxi obtain crucial intelligence such as the 'Huaihai Battlefield Situation Map'.

description.zh-cn: 将从吴石处获得的《淮海战场形势图》转交给潘汉年。
description.en: Transferred the 'Huaihai Battlefield Situation Map' obtained from Wu Shi to Pan Hannian.

description.zh-cn: 给予吴石“密使一号”的代号。
description.en: Gave Wu Shi the codename '密使一号' (Secret Envoy No. 1).

description.zh-cn: 前后秘密会面6次，向其传递情报。
description.en: Met secretly 6 times to pass intelligence to her.

description.zh-cn: 在此案中被捕并最终被判处死刑。
description.en: Was arrested and eventually sentenced to death in this case.

description.zh-cn: 在此案中被捕并最终被判处死刑。
description.en: Was arrested and eventually sentenced to death in this case.

description.zh-cn: 在此案中被判处死刑。
description.en: Was sentenced to death in this case.

description.zh-cn: 在此案中被判处死刑。
description.en: Was sentenced to death in this case.

description.zh-cn: 指派蒋鼎文、韩德勤、刘咏尧负责审判吴石案。
description.en: Appointed Jiang Dingwen, Han Deqin, and Liu Yongyao to preside over the trial of the Wu Shi case.

description.zh-cn: 作为审判官，负责审判吴石并导致其被判死刑。
description.en: As a judge, he was responsible for the trial of Wu Shi, which led to his death sentence.

description.zh-cn: 联名韩德勤、刘咏尧向蒋中正为吴石等人陈情，希望免其一死。
description.en: Jointly with Han Deqin and Liu Yongyao, he pleaded with Chiang Kai-shek for Wu Shi and others, hoping to spare them from death.

description.zh-cn: 因蒋鼎文为吴石等人说情而震怒，并予以记过处分。
description.en: Was enraged by Jiang Dingwen's plea for Wu Shi and others and gave him a demerit.

description.zh-cn: 因其父吴石的历史问题，吴兰成在文化大革命期间受到迫害，被开除党籍并剥夺行医资格。
description.en: Due to her father Wu Shi's historical issues, Wu Lancheng was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution, expelled from the party, and stripped of her medical license.

description.zh-cn: 广场上竖立有吴石的纪念雕像。
description.en: A commemorative statue of Wu Shi is erected in the square.

description.zh-cn: 针对吴石案的审判违失对国防部提出纠正。
description.en: Issued a corrective measure against the Ministry of National Defense for procedural flaws in the trial of the Wu Shi case.
